commit_message:
fix blockquote font size

The blockquote font size is 17.5px in bootstrap where normal text is
14px. This is because blockquote is thought of for doing pull
quotes. However sphinx uses block quote for indented text, and it
should thus be the same as the body text.

Part of bp:api-ref-in-rst

Change-Id: I4135686416d84f5ca113a031534c3486a4c2b1c5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/83/305783/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: /* bootstrap users blockquote for pull quotes, so they are much larger, we need them smaller */ blockquote { font-size: 1em; }

subject: FWaaS Disable nonstandard-exception due to neutron_lib shims
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-18 19:59:58.000000000', 'files': ['.pylintrc'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-fwaas/commit/e30e192d31cb1b6a5c81cc13e8f9dd89168d13cc', 'message': 'FWaaS Disable nonstandard-exception due to neutron_lib shims

The current FWaaS will fail pylint:
pylint runtests: commands[0] | pylint --rcfile=.pylintrc
--output-format=colorized neutron_fwaas
************* Module neutron_fwaas.db.firewall.firewall_db
W:621,12: Exception doesn't inherit from standard "Exception"
class (nonstandard-exception)
ERROR: InvocationError:
'/opt/stack/neutron-fwaas/.tox/pylint/bin/pylint
--rcfile=.pylintrc --output-format=colorized neutron_fwaas'

Looks like due to recent change
"FWaaS: make use of neutron_lib exceptions."
The culprit code:
   raise l3.RouterInUse(router_id=router['id'])
imports into fwaas from base Neutron as a neutron.common.exception,
not a neutron_lib.exceptions.

Quick investigation shows the neutron added following to .pylintrc:
neutron_lib shims
 nonstandard-exception,

Adding same to neutron_fwaas, complete with the TODO so will
remember to remove when neutron_lib shims are cleaned up.

Change-Id: I9bf2001e8c12038e152422051e2fb2a10214575c
'}]
commit_message:
FWaaS Disable nonstandard-exception due to neutron_lib shims

The current FWaaS will fail pylint:
pylint runtests: commands[0] | pylint --rcfile=.pylintrc
--output-format=colorized neutron_fwaas
************* Module neutron_fwaas.db.firewall.firewall_db
W:621,12: Exception doesn't inherit from standard "Exception"
class (nonstandard-exception)
ERROR: InvocationError:
'/opt/stack/neutron-fwaas/.tox/pylint/bin/pylint
--rcfile=.pylintrc --output-format=colorized neutron_fwaas'

Looks like due to recent change
"FWaaS: make use of neutron_lib exceptions."
The culprit code:
   raise l3.RouterInUse(router_id=router['id'])
imports into fwaas from base Neutron as a neutron.common.exception,
not a neutron_lib.exceptions.

Quick investigation shows the neutron added following to .pylintrc:
neutron_lib shims
 nonstandard-exception,

Adding same to neutron_fwaas, complete with the TODO so will
remember to remove when neutron_lib shims are cleaned up.

Change-Id: I9bf2001e8c12038e152422051e2fb2a10214575c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-fwaas refs/changes/88/294788/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix doc build if git is absent

When building packages if git is absent, then we should not set
html_last_updated_fmt. It can still be set via the -D switch
when building with sphinx-build.

Change-Id: I3341e13efc6011e5fc7354f7a0b0f0ede061b008
Closes-Bug: #1552251

commit_message:
Fix cinder volume stuck in swap_volume

When swap_volume is called, old_volume and new_volume are stuck
in 'detaching' and 'attaching' status respectively.

Added code in swap_volume api to attach new_volume and detach old_volume.

The bug that this patch fixes was caused by the following modification.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/101933/

It removed attaching new_volume and detaching old_volume
in swap_volume method.
As a result, cinder migrate works well,
but nova swap_volume doesn't work.

DocImpact
Change-Id: Ia66b773b404a974486863bf3d21941d55cc4fdb9
Closes-Bug: #1471098

Update bandit version

Move to a bandit version that contains fix for working in a
detached head state. This should fix the bandit gate.

commit_message:
Implement puppet-openstack-integration-checkout JJB builder

Implement puppet-openstack-integration-checkout JJB builder that will
checkout openstack/puppet-openstack-intgration in workspace root
so other-requirements.txt will be found by bindep.

Change-Id: Id05e9e9e24e94680ca642e0a83738cf1b5572d6a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/92/306492/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - builder: name: puppet-openstack-integration-checkout builders: - shell: | #!/bin/bash -xe CLONEMAP=`mktemp` function cleanup { rm -f $CLONEMAP } trap cleanup EXIT cat > $CLONEMAP << EOF clonemap: - name: openstack/puppet-openstack-integration dest: . EOF /usr/zuul-env/bin/zuul-cloner -m $CLONEMAP --cache-dir /opt/git \ git://git.openstack.org openstack/puppet-openstack-integration - puppet-openstack-integration-checkout - install-distro-packages - puppet-openstack-integration-checkout
deleted_lines: - zuul-clone: project: openstack/puppet-openstack-integration - zuul-clone: project: openstack/puppet-openstack-integration

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import json import sys def join(a, b): t = {} for k, v in a.iteritems(): nv = b.get(k) if nv is not None: if isinstance(v, basestring): t[k] = nv else: t[k] = join(v, nv) else: t[k] = v return t if __name__ == '__main__': a = json.loads(sys.stdin.readline()) b = json.loads(sys.stdin.readline()) c = json.dumps(join(a, b)) sys.stdout.write(c)

commit_message:
Remove unused cluster helper

Change-Id: Icd6e9da63afbdfcc88e5cc3f60d8036799347972
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-octane refs/changes/15/306515/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import json import os import requests import urlparse from keystoneclient.v2_0 import Client as keystoneclient class NailgunClient(object): def __init__(self, admin_node_ip, **kwargs): self.url = "http://{0}:8000".format(admin_node_ip) keystone_url = "http://{0}:5000/v2.0".format(admin_node_ip) ksclient = keystoneclient(auth_url=keystone_url, **kwargs) self.headers = {"X-Auth-Token": ksclient.auth_token, "Content-Type": "application/json"} def _get_cluster_list(self): endpoint = urlparse.urljoin(self.url, "api/clusters") return requests.get(endpoint, headers=self.headers).json() def _get_cluster(self, cluster_id): endpoint = urlparse.urljoin(self.url, "api/clusters/{0}".format(cluster_id)) return requests.get(endpoint, headers=self.headers).json() def _get_cluster_attributes(self, cluster_id): endpoint = urlparse.urljoin(self.url, "api/clusters/{0}/attributes".format( cluster_id)) return requests.get(endpoint, headers=self.headers).json() def _get_list_nodes(self): endpoint = urlparse.urljoin(self.url, "api/nodes") return requests.get(endpoint, headers=self.headers).json() def _get_list_networks(self, cluster_id): net_provider = self._get_cluster(cluster_id)["net_provider"] endpoint = urlparse.urljoin(self.url, "/api/clusters/{0}" "/network_configuration/{1}".format( cluster_id, net_provider)) return requests.get(endpoint, headers=self.headers).json() def _create_cluster(self, data): endpoint = urlparse.urljoin(self.url, "api/clusters") return requests.post(endpoint, headers=self.headers, data=json.dumps(data)) def list_cluster_nodes(self, cluster_id): endpoint = urlparse.urljoin( self.url, "api/nodes/?cluster_id={0}".format(cluster_id)) return requests.get(endpoint, headers=self.headers).json() def update_cluster_attributes(self, cluster_id, attrs): endpoint = urlparse.urljoin( self.url, "api/clusters/{0}/attributes".format(cluster_id)) return requests.put(endpoint, headers=self.headers, data=json.dumps(attrs)) def update_node(self, node_id, data): endpoint = urlparse.urljoin(self.url, "api/nodes/{0}".format(node_id)) return requests.put(endpoint, headers=self.headers, data=json.dumps(data)) def get_node_interfaces(self, node_id): endpoint = urlparse.urljoin(self.url, "api/nodes/{0}/interfaces".format(node_id)) return requests.get(endpoint, headers=self.headers).json() def put_node_interfaces(self, data): """put_node_interfaces :param data: [{'id': node_id, 'interfaces': interfaces}] :return: response """ endpoint = urlparse.urljoin(self.url, "api/nodes/interfaces") return requests.put(endpoint, headers=self.headers, data=json.dumps(data)) def update_cluster_networks(self, cluster_id, data): net_provider = self._get_cluster(cluster_id)["net_provider"] endpoint = urlparse.urljoin( self.url, "api/clusters/{0}/network_configuration/{1}".format(cluster_id, net_provider)) return requests.put(endpoint, headers=self.headers, data=json.dumps(data)) def get_node_disks(self, node_id): endpoint = urlparse.urljoin(self.url, "api/nodes/{0}/disks".format(node_id)) return requests.get(endpoint, headers=self.headers).json() def put_node_disks(self, node_id, data): endpoint = urlparse.urljoin(self.url, "api/nodes/{0}/disks".format(node_id)) return requests.put(endpoint, headers=self.headers, data=json.dumps(data)) def get_releases(self): endpoint = urlparse.urljoin(self.url, "api/releases") return requests.get(endpoint, headers=self.headers) def get_release_details(self, release_id): endpoint = urlparse.urljoin(self.url, "api/releases/{0}".format( release_id)) return requests.get(endpoint, headers=self.headers) def dump_cluster(cluster_id, fuel_node, user="admin", password="admin", tenant="admin"): client = NailgunClient(fuel_node, username=user, password=password, tenant_name=tenant) def get_cluster_id(cluster_name): for cluster in client._get_cluster_list(): if cluster["name"] == cluster_name: return cluster["id"] else: raise NameError("Can not find cluster with specified name") cluster_name = "cluster_{0}".format(str(cluster_id)) os.makedirs(cluster_name) with open("{0}/cluster.json".format(cluster_name), "w") as cluster: json.dump(client._get_cluster(cluster_id), cluster, sort_keys=False, indent=4) with open("{0}/cluster_attributes.json".format(cluster_name), "w") as cluster_attrs: json.dump(client._get_cluster_attributes(cluster_id), cluster_attrs, sort_keys=False, indent=4) with open("{0}/cluster_networks.json".format( cluster_name), "w") as cluster_net: json.dump(client._get_list_networks(cluster_id), cluster_net, sort_keys=False, indent=4) for node in client.list_cluster_nodes(cluster_id): with open("{0}/node-{1}.json".format(cluster_name, node["id"]), "w") as node_cfg: json.dump(node, node_cfg, sort_keys=False, indent=4) with open( "{0}/node-{1}-networks.json".format(cluster_name, node["id"]), "w") as node_net: json.dump(client.get_node_interfaces(node["id"]), node_net, sort_keys=False, indent=4) with open( "{0}/node-{1}-disks.json".format(cluster_name, node["id"]), "w") as node_disks: json.dump(client.get_node_disks(node["id"]), node_disks, sort_keys=False, indent=4) def restore_cluster(cluster_id, fuel_node, user="admin", password="admin", tenant="admin", upgrade=None): client = NailgunClient(fuel_node, username=user, password=password, tenant_name=tenant) folder = "cluster_{0}".format(str(cluster_id)) if os.path.isfile("{0}/cluster.json".format(folder)): with open("{0}/cluster.json".format(folder)) as cluster: cluster_data = json.load(cluster) needed_version = cluster_data["release_id"] if upgrade: restore_cluster_os_version = client.get_release_details( cluster_data["release_id"]).json()["name"].split()[:3] for release in [i for i in client.get_releases().json() if int(i["id"]) > int(cluster_data["release_id"])]: os_ver = release["name"].split() if restore_cluster_os_version[0] != os_ver[0] and \ restore_cluster_os_version[2] == os_ver[2]: needed_version = release["id"] new_cluster_data = { "name": cluster_data["name"], "release": needed_version, "mode": cluster_data["mode"], "net_provider": cluster_data["net_provider"] } if cluster_data.get("net_segment_type"): new_cluster_data["net_segment_type"] = cluster_data[ "net_segment_data"] elif os.path.isfile("{0}/cluster_networks.json".format(folder)): with open( "{0}/cluster_networks.json".format(folder) ) as cluster_nets: cluster_nets_data = json.load(cluster_nets) if cluster_data["net_provider"] == "neutron": new_cluster_data["net_segment_type"] = \ cluster_nets_data["networking_parameters"][ "segmentation_type"] else: new_cluster_data["net_manager"] = \ cluster_nets_data["networking_parameters"][ "net_manager"] new_clust = client._create_cluster(new_cluster_data).json() else: raise NameError("Can not find cluster.json") if os.path.isfile("{0}/cluster_attributes.json".format(folder)): with open( "{0}/cluster_attributes.json".format(folder)) as cluster_attrs: cluster_attrs_data = json.load(cluster_attrs) restore_cluster_attrs = client._get_cluster_attributes(new_clust["id"]) for k, _ in cluster_attrs_data["editable"].items(): for k1, v1 in cluster_attrs_data["editable"][k].items(): if "value" in v1: if "value" in restore_cluster_attrs["editable"].get( k, {}).get(k1, {}): restore_cluster_attrs["editable"][k][k1]["value"] = v1[ "value"] elif "values" in v1: if "values" in restore_cluster_attrs["editable"].get( k, {}).get(k1, {}): restore_cluster_attrs[ "editable"][k][k1]["values"] = v1["values"] client.update_cluster_attributes(new_clust["id"], restore_cluster_attrs) if os.path.isfile("{0}/cluster_networks.json".format(folder)): with open("{0}/cluster_networks.json".format(folder)) as cluster_nets: cluster_nets_data = json.load(cluster_nets) restore_cluster_nets_data = client._get_list_networks(new_clust["id"]) for key, value in cluster_nets_data["networking_parameters"].items(): if key == "base_mac": continue restore_cluster_nets_data["networking_parameters"][key] = value for net in cluster_nets_data["networks"]: if net["name"] == "fuelweb_admin": continue for new_net in restore_cluster_nets_data["networks"]: if net["name"] == new_net["name"]: for key, value in net.items(): if key in ["cluster_id", "id", "meta", "group_id"]: continue new_net[key] = value client.update_cluster_networks(new_clust["id"], restore_cluster_nets_data) return new_clust["id"]

commit_message:
Ensure all units provide ceph-public-addr

radosgw relation was only providing information
when executed by a leader unit. This patch ensures
that the minimum info is provided regardless.

Change-Id: I2f841933f70847fb1bddc94f5ae525f5588021c2
Closes-Bug: 1570823

subject: docs: Remove warnings from "api-ref"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-06 09:38:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/bd48c66d0918129a2fd46e53758024bc783fd452', 'message': 'docs: Remove warnings from "api-ref"

When building the docs or the api-ref, these warnings (among others)
will occur:

    api-ref/source/servers.rst:102: WARNING: 
    duplicate label 
    list-servers-lists-ids-names-and-links-for-all-servers-selector, 
    other instance in ~/git/nova/api-ref/source/servers.rst  
  
    checking consistency... 
    ~/git/nova/api-ref/source/servers.rst:: 
    WARNING: document isn't included in any toctree

This is due to the usage of ".. include::" in combination with the 
"conf.py" setting "source_suffix = '.rst'". The duplicate detection
of sphinx will find then the labels twice, in "servers.rst" and also
"index.rst". Also sphinx doesn't find the *.rst files in any toctree.

The "include" directive got chosen to build one single document out of
multiple other documents (servers.rst + versions.rst). This change
alters the file extension of the included files to "*.inc", which
seems to be common practice of others who want to achive the same
result. This also solves the toctree warning. It keeps the "api-ref"
source open for other "*.rst" files which are not intented to be
included with the ".. included::" directive.

The commands "tox -e api-ref" and "tox -e docs" will now run without
warnings. Which enables us to also treat future warnings as errors,
hence the "tox.ini" build targets can use the "-W" flag.

To make the results reproducible, we remove previous build results
via "tox.ini" commands enhancement "rm -rf".

Change-Id: If9629aaa7b6743d056199f7f35bb67c4e21214c8

commit_message:
docs: Remove warnings from "api-ref"

When building the docs or the api-ref, these warnings (among others)
will occur:

    api-ref/source/servers.rst:102: WARNING:
    duplicate label
    list-servers-lists-ids-names-and-links-for-all-servers-selector,
    other instance in ~/git/nova/api-ref/source/servers.rst

    checking consistency...
    ~/git/nova/api-ref/source/servers.rst::
    WARNING: document isn't included in any toctree

This is due to the usage of ".. include::" in combination with the
"conf.py" setting "source_suffix = '.rst'". The duplicate detection
of sphinx will find then the labels twice, in "servers.rst" and also
"index.rst". Also sphinx doesn't find the *.rst files in any toctree.

The "include" directive got chosen to build one single document out of
multiple other documents (servers.rst + versions.rst). This change
alters the file extension of the included files to "*.inc", which
seems to be common practice of others who want to achive the same
result. This also solves the toctree warning. It keeps the "api-ref"
source open for other "*.rst" files which are not intented to be
included with the ".. included::" directive.

The commands "tox -e api-ref" and "tox -e docs" will now run without
warnings. Which enables us to also treat future warnings as errors,
hence the "tox.ini" build targets can use the "-W" flag.

To make the results reproducible, we remove previous build results
via "tox.ini" commands enhancement "rm -rf".

Change-Id: If9629aaa7b6743d056199f7f35bb67c4e21214c8

commit_message:
Revert "puppet: use gerrit-git-prep for all jobs"

It was a mistake, we don't checkout puppet-openstack-integration anymore, while we should. I'll propose a patch later that address the bindep issue.

This reverts commit 0d60a1572d6d4b1ef3352058f73e82ee9ea5614a.

Change-Id: Ic836014135d3ae6955dafd41f30b5bd1c6c43b61

commit_message:
Wait for the interfaces to get IP addresses before inspection

In the DIB build the DHCP code (provided by the dhcp-all-interfaces element)
races with the service starting IPA. It does not matter for deployment itself,
as we're waiting for the route to the Ironic API to appear. However, for
inspection it may result in reporting back all NIC's without IP addresses.
Inspection fails in this case.

This change makes inspection wait for *all* NIC's to get their IP addresses up
to a small timeout. The timeout is 60 seconds by default and can be changed
via the new ipa-inspection-dhcp-wait-timeout kernel option (0 to not wait).

After the wait inspection proceedes in any case, so the worst downside
is making inspection 60 seconds longer.

To avoid waiting for NIC's that are not even connected, this change extends the
NetworkInterface class with 'has_carrier' field.

Closes-Bug: #1564954
Change-Id: I5bf14de4c1c622f4bf6e3eadbe20c44759da5d66
(cherry picked from commit 3deb25a3cec7955c5e38d83af74add58478f884c)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent refs/changes/16/305916/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

' 'Set to 0 to disable waiting completely.'),

commit_message:
Make sure to clean the blacklist cache when disabling the firewall

Otherwise on reintrospection the firewall code may not update
iptables rules, assuming they are already correct.

Change-Id: Icc05174854bd9ab51bfed9d1360873bf5db9ed54
Closes-Bug: #1570447
(cherry picked from commit 41580add20b20cb28dcacb5012c85a89cb46d830)

commit_message:
Fixed Heat system tests

We added new Heat API services in Mitaka release
and we need to update system tests to properly check
the count of Heat services on controller nodes.

Change-Id: I5e0a0c24947f751bcd493030b0645d3b1e6175ab
Closes-bug: #1569893

Fixed Heat system tests

We added new Heat API services in Mitaka release
and we need to update system tests to properly check
the count of Heat services on controller nodes.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-09 10:16:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/e6c16025fa31aea25dc3821912fca8ebe7dfbe56', 'message': "Add script for migrating to reference ipam driver

To be able to use pluggable ipam driver for greyfield deployments
data migration script is needed. Migrate script populates information
from built-in ipam implementation to reference ipam driver.

Built-in ipam implementation uses next ipam related db models:
- Subnet
- IPAllocationPool
- IPAllocation
- IPAvailabilityRange
And reference ipam driver has counterpart models with similar scructure:
- IpamSubnet
- IpamAllocationPool
- IpamAllocation
- IpamAvailabilityRange
IpamSubnet has different ids comparing to Subnet model, so during data
migration remapping from neutron_subnet_id to ipam_subnet_id is needed.
IpamSubnet does not have index on neutron_subnet_id field, so joining
by this field would be extremely slow. To achieve O(1) time for lookup
neutron_subnet_id to ipam_subnet_id mapping is stored as a dict.

Note:
Currently migration script is tested in dependent patch, where
ipam_driver is set to default. For now neutron-populate-ipam-data
is called from alembic migration on upgrade in
gate-grenade-dsvm-neutron.

Next part probably should go as release notes.
Expected workflow of migrating to pluggable ipam:
- Upgrade to Mitaka (if not done already)
- Turn off neutron-server (if enabled)
- Edit neutron.conf and set 'ipam_driver = internal'
- Run neutron-populate-ipam-data
- Turn on neutron-server

Change-Id: I257cd61cfbdcba42c35fbfddc257a216bf9a216f
Closes-Bug: #1516156

- Subnet

- IpamAvailabilityRange

pluggable and vise versa.
To migrate back to built-in implementation 'rebuild' flag has to be
used. It cause availability ranges rebuild. All other 'built-in' ipam
tables are receiving updates even if pluggable ipam driver is used
(these tables are API exposed and still have to be updated).
To migrate data back to built-in ipam implementation there is no
need to use data from pluggable ipam and it reduces risk of corrupting
data.

So running 'neutron-populate-ipam-data --rebuild' on any backend any
count of times will populate database with all needed data for current
backend.

Added release notes with steps to migrate from built-in ipam to
pluggalbe ipam.

Note:
Currently migration script is tested in dependent patch, where
ipam_driver is set to default. For now neutron-populate-ipam-data
is called from alembic migration on upgrade in
gate-grenade-dsvm-neutron.

still have to be updated).

'neutron-migrate-ipam-to-pluggable' script and it is safe to use only
if ipam backend is switched the first time.

commit_message:
Add script for migrating to reference ipam driver

To be able to use pluggable ipam driver for greyfield deployments
a data migration script is needed. It populates information
from built-in ipam implementation to reference ipam driver.

Built-in ipam implementation uses next ipam related db models:
- Subnet
- IPAllocationPool
- IPAllocation
- IPAvailabilityRange
And reference ipam driver has counterpart models with similar scructure:
- IpamSubnet
- IpamAllocationPool
- IpamAllocation
- IpamAvailabilityRange
IpamSubnet has different ids comparing to Subnet model, so during data
migration remapping from neutron_subnet_id to ipam_subnet_id is needed.
IpamSubnet does not have index on neutron_subnet_id field, so joining
by this field would be extremely slow. To achieve O(1) time for lookup
neutron_subnet_id to ipam_subnet_id mapping is stored as a dict during
execution of migrate script.

Data migration can be done in both directions:
- 'neutron-migrate-ipam-to-pluggable' - migrates data from built-in to
  pluggable
- 'neutron-migrate-ipam-to-built-in' - migrates data from pluggable to
  built-in

By default availability ranges are recalculated during migration.
It is done because source table that contains availability ranges can
become out-of-date in case of switching ipam backend multiple times.
All other 'built-in' ipam tables are receiving updates even
if pluggable ipam driver is used (these tables are API exposed and
still have to be updated).

Rebuilding availability ranges is slower than direct data copying.
If migration time is critical operator can specify '--quick' flag
to force direct data copying. This option applies only for
'neutron-migrate-ipam-to-pluggable' script and it is safe to use only
if ipam backend is switched the first time.

Added release notes with steps to migrate from built-in ipam to
pluggable ipam.

Note:
Currently migration script is tested in dependent patch, where
ipam_driver is set to default. For now
neutron-migrate-ipam-to-pluggable is called from alembic migration on
upgrade in gate-grenade-dsvm-neutron.

Change-Id: I257cd61cfbdcba42c35fbfddc257a216bf9a216f
Closes-Bug: #1516156
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/67/277767/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/usr/bin/env python # Copyright (c) 2015 Infoblox Inc. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import sys from oslo_log import log as logging from oslo_utils import uuidutils from neutron._i18n import _LI from neutron.common import config from neutron import context as ctxt from neutron.db import models_v2 from neutron.ipam.drivers.neutrondb_ipam import db_models LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) def log_created_object(obj): LOG.debug("Creating %s: %s", obj.__class__.__name__, obj) def migrate_to_reference_driver(context): map_neutron_id_to_ipam = {} with context.session.begin(subtransactions=True): # clean_up any old records in ipam tables # and then build them from scratch context.session.query(db_models.IpamSubnet).delete() for subnet_tuple in context.session.query(models_v2.Subnet.id): subnet_id = subnet_tuple[0] ipam_id = uuidutils.generate_uuid() map_neutron_id_to_ipam[subnet_id] = ipam_id ipam_subnet = db_models.IpamSubnet( id=ipam_id, neutron_subnet_id=subnet_id) log_created_object(ipam_subnet) context.session.add(ipam_subnet) for pool in context.session.query(models_v2.IPAllocationPool): ipam_pool = db_models.IpamAllocationPool( ipam_subnet_id=map_neutron_id_to_ipam[pool.subnet_id], first_ip=pool.first_ip, last_ip=pool.last_ip) log_created_object(ipam_pool) context.session.add(ipam_pool) # Note(pbondar): alternatively we could force availability # ranges rebuild once allocation_pools and ip_allocations are in # place, but it might be much slower than direct copy for av_range in pool.available_ranges: ipam_range = db_models.IpamAvailabilityRange( allocation_pool_id=ipam_pool.id, first_ip=av_range.first_ip, last_ip=av_range.last_ip) log_created_object(ipam_range) context.session.add(ipam_range) for ip_alloc in context.session.query(models_v2.IPAllocation): allocation = db_models.IpamAllocation( ip_address=ip_alloc.ip_address, status='ALLOCATED', ipam_subnet_id=map_neutron_id_to_ipam[ip_alloc.subnet_id]) log_created_object(allocation) context.session.add(allocation) def main(): config.init(sys.argv[1:]) config.setup_logging() context = ctxt.get_admin_context() if config.cfg.CONF.ipam_driver == 'internal': LOG.info(_LI("Populating data for reference ipam driver")) migrate_to_reference_driver(context) else: LOG.info(_LI("Reference ipam driver is not used. Exiting."))

commit_message:
Make sure to clean the blacklist cache when disabling the firewall

Otherwise on reintrospection the firewall code may not update
iptables rules, assuming they are already correct.

Change-Id: Icc05174854bd9ab51bfed9d1360873bf5db9ed54
Closes-Bug: #1570447
(cherry picked from commit 41580add20b20cb28dcacb5012c85a89cb46d830)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-inspector refs/changes/29/306429/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: global ENABLED, BLACKLIST_CACHE BLACKLIST_CACHE = None

commit_message:
Change release model for networking-ovn.

OVN itself is aiming for a production release in time for the OpenStack
Newton release.  We'd like to switch release models so that we're
releasing the Neutron plugin with the Newton release.

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-April/091289.html

Change-Id: Id375d74ec487e0f2757cf3230ca3611a0b92285f
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/governance refs/changes/25/301325/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - release:cycle-with-milestones

subject: add scripts for performing YAML validation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-12 16:12:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/commit/2c3c78a81c3ebc8392b1528503ece4606341328d', 'message': 'add scripts for performing YAML validation

this commit adds scripts for validating YAML documents, as well as a
wrapper for git pre-commit hooks.  The ci-scripts/validate-yaml
script will check individual files or entire directories, e.g:

    ./ci-scripts/validate-yaml playbooks

The ci-scripts/pre-commit-hook script is meant to be installed as a
git pre-commit hook:

    ln -s $PWD/ci-scripts/pre-commit-hook .git/hooks/pre-commit

This will run any executable scripts in `ci-scripts/pre-commit.d`.
There is one scripts there, `ci-scripts/pre-commit.d/validate-yaml-in-commit`, which will validate all of the .yml documents contained in a commit.  This can prevent CI failures do to simple syntax errors by ensuring that the yaml documents are correct before submitting a change to gerrit.

Change-Id: I088e7b56a066e9b8520af9d54489b8a61d8bc29b
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-15 00:51:05.000000000', 'files': ['ci-scripts/validate-yaml', 'ci-scripts/pre-commit-hook', 'ci-scripts/pre-commit.d/validate-yaml-in-commit'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/commit/031b360f22a12bb03d0fe928a26dc18e71732537', 'message': 'add scripts for performing YAML validation

    ln -s $PWD/ci-scripts/pre-commit-hook .git/hooks/pre-commit

This will run any executable scripts in `ci-scripts/pre-commit.d`.
There is one scripts there, `ci-scripts/pre-commit.d/validate-yaml-in-commit`, which will validate all of the .yml documents contained in a commit.  This can prevent CI failures do to simple syntax errors by ensuring that the yaml documents are correct before submitting a change to gerrit.

Change-Id: I088e7b56a066e9b8520af9d54489b8a61d8bc29b
'}]
commit_message:
add scripts for performing YAML validation

this commit adds scripts for validating YAML documents, as well as a
wrapper for git pre-commit hooks.  The ci-scripts/validate-yaml
script will check individual files or entire directories, e.g:

    ./ci-scripts/validate-yaml playbooks

The ci-scripts/pre-commit-hook script is meant to be installed as a
git pre-commit hook:

    ln -s $PWD/ci-scripts/pre-commit-hook .git/hooks/pre-commit

This will run any executable scripts in `ci-scripts/pre-commit.d`.
There is one scripts there, `ci-scripts/pre-commit.d/validate-yaml-in-commit`, which will validate all of the .yml documents contained in a commit.  This can prevent CI failures do to simple syntax errors by ensuring that the yaml documents are correct before submitting a change to gerrit.

Change-Id: I088e7b56a066e9b8520af9d54489b8a61d8bc29b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/37/304737/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/sh SCRIPTS="$PWD/ci-scripts" tmpdir=$(mktemp -d commitXXXXXX) trap "rm -rf $tmpdir" EXIT # This checks out the index into a temporary directory, which is # necessary if you want to validate the files that are actually # part of the commit (because when performing an interactive add, # for example, files in a commit may not actually match the content # of files in the working directory). git checkout-index --prefix=$tmpdir/ -af git diff --cached --name-only --diff-filter=ACM | grep '.yml' | ( cd $tmpdir xargs --no-run-if-empty $SCRIPTS/validate-yaml )

commit_message:
Change magnum deliverables release tags

Change magnum-ui and python-magnumclient from release:independent
to release:cycle-with-intermediary. Magnum commits to follow the
release model and deliver a final release at end of the cycle.

Change-Id: I590a674c7767f3b940e24db9e2791e290b464a6a

commit_message:
Remove global-requirements build from the build process

Currently the build process builds all the wheels for all packages
listed in OpenStack's global requirements.

This is a wasteful process as it contains packages needed by all
OpenStack projects, instead of just the projects OpenStack-Ansible
deploys in the integrated build.

This patch removes the wheel build of all global requirements and
switches the repo build process to only building the wheels that
are actually needed.

Depends-On: I6536993523f02ba49da741b9ea21535eb33fe402
Change-Id: I5a865391803de2beef49c61b55277fad6317561f
(cherry picked from commit b70baeb461155993528c6e6209a8366b208a520d)

commit_message:
update repo-build for ansible 2.1 compat

This change updates the repo-build process to be ansible2.1
compatible. The change is needed because the if statements in the
sting cause a \\ to exist if the variables are not used. To resolve
this issue the entry to the shell call has been changed to a folding
style instead of a literal style which will no longer generate the \\.

A change was also need in the op-venv script where we rely on a bash
script to build all of the venvs based on input provided by a folding
style string. Within Ansible 2.x the folding string type may have a \n
on the end which will break direct bash bash functions.

Change-Id: I394ab60f5505a45cf39b1efce1016dad9332be78
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit d9154a3a9df907a22ace30c4fc38dc2e53c5ded6)

commit_message:
Remove venv activation code

This commit uses the pattern established in [1] to remove the venv
activation code by using the correct venv Python interpreter instead.

Note that using python-path in keystone-httpd.conf.j2 does not achieve
full isolation from the host's python installation as we'd hope (the
path will still include /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages and
/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages), but every attempt at using
python-home failed due to the venv interpreter not being able to find
argparse.  We will need to spend some additional cycles here trying to
solve this as locking the venv interpreter into its own site-packages
is the best solution long-term.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/273943/

Change-Id: I441d8e488d9396583b4fafd454d14bc3fce20eb1
(cherry picked from commit 36486b16b4ce1426b2021b8b84bdf0d9fb077334)

commit_message:
puppet: use gerrit-git-prep for all jobs

Stop using zuul-clone macro because the other-requirements.txt was not
found by install-distro-packages.sh script, since it looks at the root
of the workspace.
By using gerrit-git-prep, we have the repo directly at the root of the
workspace, other-requirements.txt will be found and we'll unblock our
CI, that is currently broken because some packages are installed by
default bindep packages.

Change-Id: I5be52b5790655d4361817890f2bf4af382924e2c

commit_message:
Do not pre-install dependencies from OpenStack Infra

Add an empty other-requirements.txt file to prevent the
openstack gate environment to pre-install dependencies for
us; these are installed by our Puppet modules or run_tests.sh script.

Change-Id: I96c733b03933cce04b0beee8952a2c49f83bb5b5

commit_message:
Fix retrieving VM notes race condition

If the VM is deleted while we attempt to retrieve the VM notes, we
sometimes get a TypeError when we try to iterate over them, as the
Notes property will be set to None.

This change fixes the issue by storing this field in a different
variable, before attempting to use it.

Closes-Bug: #1569815

Change-Id: I89e73df9406a55e087751d20450e134be60867e6
(cherry picked from commit 70d3658d2635317bd785532c7d6fbc858ff05abe)

commit_message:
Cinder verifies getting volume list with marker

Begin returning volumes that appear later in the
volume list than that represented by this volume id

Steps:
- Choosing a random volume from a list of volumes for
  'marker' parameter
- Running volume list using marker parameter
- Validating the expected list is the same like the
  observed list

Change-Id: Ibbf257bc1b270b79ce838ab7e724094934f2e3fa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/80/289780/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import random self._test_pagination('volumes', ids=self.volume_id_list, detail=False) @test.idempotent_id('46eff077-100b-427f-914e-3db2abcdb7e2') def test_volume_list_with_detail_param_marker(self): # Creating a dictionary which will fetch the volumes ids and the time # they were created volumes_times = {} volume_list_local = self.client.list_volumes(detail=True)['volumes'] for vol in volume_list_local: volumes_times[vol['created_at']] = vol['id'] # Creating a list, sorted according to the time they have created sorted_times = sorted(volumes_times) # Choosing a random volume from a list of volumes for 'marker' # parameter random_time = random.choice(sorted_times) params = {'marker': volumes_times[random_time]} # Running volume list using marker parameter vol_with_marker = self.client.list_volumes(detail=True, params=params)['volumes'] # Fetching the index of the random volume from sorted_times list index_marker = sorted_times.index(random_time) # The expected list with marker parameter verify_volume_list = sorted_times[:index_marker] # Validating the expected list is the same like the observed list self.assertEqual(verify_volume_list, sorted(map(lambda x: x['created_at'], vol_with_marker)), "Failed to list volume details by marker")

commit_message:
Add ability to change roles during upgrade nodes

This change allows to specify new roles in the new environment using
the `--roles` option:

    $ octane upgrade-node --roles=<role1>,<role2> <env> <node1> <node2>

Change-Id: Ie4f6863047ba3a9bb76d7b22ceeaa70927ca9fc1
Depends-On: Iedb20a904e58f5b9a86eb47de8d8d317dc3cc61b

commit_message:
Adjust ansible-role-requirements-editor file open options

This implements more correct file open options. While this is
not strictly required it does appear to make the script behave
more consistently across different platforms.

The patch also renames the file name and related content to
ensure that the tool is correctly spelled.

Change-Id: Idde0141691e1008bead802bd6f3759c12e37b02b

commit_message:
Openswan/Libreswan: support sha256 for auth algorithm

Add support for sha256 as it is requirement from customer.
Currently, there is no ike/esp fields in strongswan ipsec.conf
template, so by default. sha256 is used. But for openswan auth
algorithm is get from configuration, so only sha1 is supported.
This patch enable Openswan/Libreswan to support sha256.

Note: this change is DocImpact and APIImpact

Change-Id: I02c80ec3494eb0edef2fdaa5d21ca0c3bbcacac2
Closes-Bug: #1567846

commit_message:
Fix totp test fails randomly

The test_with_multiple_users test would fail if the time happened to
roll over to the next chunk for the totp generator. The fix is to
control the clock in the test to this can't happen.

Change-Id: I2b92a0cc08ba8e36edc87cb76960a46746895458
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/81/301881/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_utils import timeutils return totp.generate(timeutils.utcnow_ts(microsecond=True))

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-13 15:32:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/25b658c11697c301b858209ef31d7b6b4c4b39ba', 'message': "Fix css references to the glyphicons font

tree.

commit_message:
Fix css references to the glyphicons font

The bootstrap css uses the glyphicons font, but sphinx can't put it
exactly in the same place that bootstrap wants it. So fix the
minimized css to make it available and include those fonts in our
tree.

Part of bp:api-ref-in-rst

Change-Id: Ib45b90966ce12194fcb571c2782b1baed7af2471

commit_message:
Allow to upgrade nodes without re-provisioning

It's possible to reassign nodes from the upgrade environment to the seed
environment without re-provisioning.

    $ octane upgrade-node --no-provision <env> <node1> <node2>

Change-Id: I1fb88c6c7e0581034d8668373ecaa3ace2d085af
Depends-On: Iedb20a904e58f5b9a86eb47de8d8d317dc3cc61b

commit_message:
Do not pre-install dependencies from OpenStack Infra

Add an empty other-requirements.txt file to prevent the
openstack gate environment to pre-install dependencies for
us; these are installed by our Puppet modules or run_tests.sh script.

(cherry picked from commit 046de82d33a087ba140a9943fdf6fd13379591a7)

commit_message:
Change Murano Glance Artifact Plugin location

Since this plugin is used only by Murano and this
plugin should be enabled by default, it's moved to
Murano settings section, which is hidden in case of
Murano is disabled.

Change-Id: I8ebac4405a1eaede18a35acbbab7b202b6aac754
Closes-Bug: #1569944

commit_message:
ensure mysql defaults file is sourced

The mysql initscript that comes with mariadb-10.0 does not source the
/etc/default/mysql file, meaning that the MYSQLD_STARTUP_TIMEOUT that
we set in there is being ignored.  This has the effect of causing some
nodes to timeout their startup too early, interrupting the initial SST,
and causing the cluster join to fail.

This commit adds a line to the initscript to ensure that we are
sourcing /etc/default/mysql correctly.

Closes-Bug: #1569446
Co-Authored-By: Jimmy McCrory <jimmy.mccrory@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I6af1cc660c2bbc2a49707cfab995659dc0167f2f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-galera_server refs/changes/98/306298/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE: (mancdaz) this should not be needed with mariadb-10.1 since its # initscript sources /etc/default/mariadb - name: fix mysql startup timeout lineinfile: dest: /etc/init.d/mysql state: present insertafter: '^export HOME=/etc/mysql/' line: '[ -r /etc/default/mysql ] && . /etc/default/mysql' backup: yes # NOTE: (mancdaz) The target will need to change to /etc/default/mariadb # for mariadb-10.1

commit_message:
pin google-api-client to 0.9.4

google-api-client requires Ruby version ~> 2.0, so we need to pin to
0.9.4.

See https://github.com/google/google-api-ruby-client/issues/397

Change-Id: I8a6e5e56c1e6d36e66febd878507f8eef5c5a738
Closes-Bug: #1570627

commit_message:
Fix cluster scaling operations

This patch fixes cluster scaling operations so that cluster's
desired_capacity will change no matter physical nodes are
created/deleted successfully or not. The desired capacity should be
changed provided the logical nodes are operated successfully.

Closes-Bug: 1537663
Change-Id: I29387e856fde86f001d212a5063f861bb57caeec
(cherry picked from commit 8d79ba257e0a14582b67eabd08667ba27b19cf40)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/72/306372/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Removing previously created resources in pingtest and --skip-pingtest-cleanup option

If the pingtest fails in somepoint, images and network resources
are still created, in the case of pingtest images, they are created
with different ID's and when referencing the i.e. pingtest_image
by name, an error is returned as there are more than one image with the same
name.

This patch in the cleanup, removes all pingtest_* images.
And at the beginning of the overcloud_pingtest method
removes all the previous images or the nova network.

Also for debuging purposes a --skip-pingtest-cleanup option is added,
which allows not to delete the resources create in the pingtest

Change-Id: I10670af03510a7735433e37009e37c59fd0af3f4
Closes-Bug: #1569309

commit_message:
Add job to test Nova with specific libvirt and kvm packages

Nova has sometimes the need to exploit features of libvirt which
are not yet in the default libvirt version of our testing
infrastructure.
This change adds a test job which is able to set up a devstack node
which runs with specific libvirt and kvm packages.

Change-Id: Ifd231857cffd134e911225088d6dc65bf61fdedd

commit_message:
Make sure to clean the blacklist cache when disabling the firewall

Otherwise on reintrospection the firewall code may not update
iptables rules, assuming they are already correct.

Change-Id: Icc05174854bd9ab51bfed9d1360873bf5db9ed54
Closes-Bug: #1570447
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-inspector refs/changes/60/305960/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: global ENABLED, BLACKLIST_CACHE BLACKLIST_CACHE = None

commit_message:
Add trove to install guide

The install guide currently does not
include trove.

This spec outlines a  new  proposed install guide
section that describes how to install trove.

Change-Id: I0dd02dba6ad8eeba0df172715b110c72743081b7
blueprint: installguide-add-trove
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/docs-specs refs/changes/53/290053/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ==================================== Add trove to the installation guide ==================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/openstack-manuals/+spec/create-trove-install-guide Add trove to the installation guide. Problem description =================== The installation guide does not include trove, but trove packages are available in the distros' repositories. Essential documents also already support trove: - `trove admin guide cloud <http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide-cloud/database.html>`__ - `trove user guide cmd line <http://docs.openstack.org/user-guide/trove-manage-db.html>`__ - `trove user guide dashboard <http://docs.openstack.org/user-guide/dashboard_databases.html>`__ - `trove configuration reference <http://docs.openstack.org/liberty/config-reference/content/ch_configuring-trove.html>`__ - `trove API reference <http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-database-v1.html>`__ Proposed change =============== Add the following trove content to the installation guide: **Prerequisites:** Working OpenStack environment with at least Compute, Image Service, Identity. - Backup and restore, add Object Storage. - Provision datastores on block-storage volumes, add Block Storage. **Installation:** Install required packages. Source ``admin-openrc.sh`` and create trove user. Set OpenStack service URLs and RabbitMQ values in ``trove.conf``, ``trove-taskmanager.conf``, and ``trove-conductor.conf``. Set correct ``api-paste.ini`` file values for ``auth_uri``, ``identity_uri``, ``admin_user``, ``admin_password``, ``admin_tenant_name``, ``signing_dir``. Edit ``trove.conf`` for default datastore, network label, regex, and API information. Edit ``trove-taskmanager.conf`` to connect to the OpenStack Compute service. Prepare the trove admin database. Initialize database and create datastore. Create a trove image. Update the datastore to use the new image. Register trove with keystone. To deal with Ubuntu package bug - change the service startup scripts to use the correct conf files. Start or restart (depending on env) trove services. Alternatives ------------ None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Laurel Michaels Work Items ---------- None Dependencies ============ Mitaka milestone or RC packages for each distribution supported by the Installation Guide. Testing ======= Validate trove deployment on all distributions supported by the installation guide. References ========== None

commit_message:
Fix dimension validation of alarms

Dimension key & value pair have ':' delimiter, not '='.
And Fix dimension multi value problem.

Enhance the assert message from ErrorMessages to make it easier to
see why tests failed

Change-Id: Ia131b2caaa5d219f427e4976011ef22075e16038

added_lines: name_value = dimension.split(':') if len(name_value) > 1: if '|' in name_value[1]: values = name_value[1].split('|') for value in values: validation.dimension_value(value) else: validation.dimension_value(name_value[1])
deleted_lines: name_value = dimension.split('=') if len(name_value) > 1 and '|' in name_value[1]: values = name_value[1].split('|') for value in values: validation.dimension_value(value)

commit_message:
FIX installation to enable to install after unstack

Some commands of installation fail when executing after unstack,
because the resouces are remained after unstack.
This patch avoids this situation by allowing the commands to fail and
checking the existence of directories.

Change-Id: I337de2b931b58f4e4cd3d5570f6752cc3f8c1dbd
Closes-Bug: 1569149

commit_message:
Move assertExpected fucntion to base class

Function assertExpected can be used in multiple tests
so moving this to base test class.

Change-Id: I35c3cc2c25af6b96169e926fc68fa74130db8c4b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate-tempest-plugin refs/changes/23/305723/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import six def assertExpected(self, expected, actual, excluded_keys): for key, value in six.iteritems(expected): if key not in excluded_keys: self.assertIn(key, actual) self.assertEqual(value, actual[key], key)

subject: StackAction parameter to distinguish top-level create vs. update
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-07 11:57:49.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_common/tests/test_update.py', 'tripleo_common/update.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common/commit/03eb4b44af7fa30b0edf8ddf58aa330161ea6d54', 'message': 'StackAction parameter to distinguish top-level create vs. update

Previously we tried to use UpdateIdentifier for two different things:
tell whether to perform package update, and also to tell whether the
top-level stack is being created or updated (which was incorrect and
resulted in bug 1567384, and an attempt to work around that bug resulted
in bug 1567385).

We cannot use Heat's "action" conditionals in some cases, because they
refer to the direct parent stack, which can yield undesirable results
when introducing new nested stacks or temporarily no-opping something
and then adding it back (in both these cases, "action" would be
considered "CREATE", even though the top-level stack is in "UPDATE").

Change-Id: I5e7eb522521d985f374db91e7258e5b474b6b2c9
Related-Bug: #1567384
Related-Bug: #1567385
'}]
commit_message:
StackAction parameter to distinguish top-level create vs. update

Previously we tried to use UpdateIdentifier for two different things:
tell whether to perform package update, and also to tell whether the
top-level stack is being created or updated (which was incorrect and
resulted in bug 1567384, and an attempt to work around that bug resulted
in bug 1567385).

We cannot use Heat's "action" conditionals in some cases, because they
refer to the direct parent stack, which can yield undesirable results
when introducing new nested stacks or temporarily no-opping something
and then adding it back (in both these cases, "action" would be
considered "CREATE", even though the top-level stack is in "UPDATE").

commit_message:
Unset UpdateIdentifier on deploy/scale, pass in StackAction

Previously we tried to use UpdateIdentifier for two different things:
tell whether to perform package update, and also to tell whether the
top-level stack is being created or updated (which was incorrect and
resulted in bug 1567384, and an attempt to work around that bug resulted
in bug 1567385).

We cannot use Heat's "action" conditionals in some cases, because they
refer to the direct parent stack, which can yield undesirable results
when introducing new nested stacks or temporarily no-opping something
and then adding it back (in both these cases, "action" would be
considered "CREATE", even though the top-level stack is in "UPDATE").

So we clear UpdateIdentifier on deploy/scale to make sure that package
update doesn't get triggered, and we pass new StackAction parameter to
allow us to correctly distinguish between create vs. update of the
top-level stack, and condition the pacemaker restarts on this variable
instead.

Change-Id: I9dc3b4cd8a6a71df34d8babf0e4c6505041f5311
Related-Bug: #1567384
Closes-Bug: #1567385
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/20/302720/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: parameters['UpdateIdentifier'] = None parameters['StackAction'] = 'CREATE' if stack_is_new else 'UPDATE'

commit_message:
tcpdump is missing in the base

tcpdump is indespensable troubleshooting tool and currently it is
missing in kolla deployment. This patch adds tcpdump binaries to
the base image.

Change-Id: Ia40e605400deed0d845029b5a49f28bcc109f74b
Closes-Bug: #1570396

subject: Fix random failure of security group unit test
revisions:

CLITestV20SecurityGroupsJSON.test_extend_list_exceed_max_uri_len
fails randomly because this test uses query parameters and
the order of query parameters in a construct URL is not deterministic.
As a result the test failed randomly.
The test should use MyUrlComparator to compare URLs.
MyUrlComparator ignores the order parameters when comparing URLs.

Change-Id: I8a8116f45583102fa1351d17a1cc5174bdce3cc9
Closes-Bug: #1570689
'}]
commit_message:
Fix random failure of security group unit test

CLITestV20SecurityGroupsJSON.test_extend_list_exceed_max_uri_len
fails randomly because this test uses query parameters and
the order of query parameters in a construct URL is not deterministic.
As a result the test failed randomly.
The test should use MyUrlComparator to compare URLs.
MyUrlComparator ignores the order parameters when comparing URLs.

Change-Id: I8a8116f45583102fa1351d17a1cc5174bdce3cc9
Closes-Bug: #1570689
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-neutronclient refs/changes/31/306231/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Align git branches for tests

We need to use stable/mitaka branch both in python-fuelclient
and fuel-web

Switching to full repo cloning since for now we need
checkout to other branches

Change-Id: Ib3018bcda4e9e89a1ca9f80447883896f4db3b8c
Related-bug: #1558589

not use mox for conductor/test_conductor.py

in conductor/test_conductor.py

Part of blueprint remove-mox

  - name: pluginname

      - name: plugin-name-1.0
        priority: 1100
        ...
   - name: plugin2

It is necessary to update how hiera_config finds plugin names
because they are stored in the name key now.

Change-Id: I67b06b46d56892bfab3d39cd98bee35bfdac06a0
Partial-Bug: #1565061
(cherry picked from commit 06707b792c7104d6340359631e41cf17105897a5)

commit_message:
Update hiera_config to parse plugins as a list of hashes

Plugins are listed in hiera now with the following format:
- plugins:
  - name: pluginname
    repositories:
      - name: plugin-name-1.0
        priority: 1100
        ...
   - name: plugin2
   ...

It is necessary to update how hiera_config finds plugin names
because they are stored in the name key now.

Change-Id: I67b06b46d56892bfab3d39cd98bee35bfdac06a0
Partial-Bug: #1565061
(cherry picked from commit 06707b792c7104d6340359631e41cf17105897a5)
(cherry picked from commit cc6f3274e03e8ad8cf60da9d15c096353a07515a)

commit_message:
Fix typo: locale -> local

A translation scripts handles locales but still variables need to be
declared "local".

fix typo.

Also, lowercase local variable "pot" and add a missing local
declaration.

Change-Id: I5e4df1034fd6e713be5961b1e083d600d53bb8fc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/68/306368/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
neutron: pci_request logic considers 'direct-physical' vnic type

Since the following change:

If1ab969c2002c649a3d51635ca2765c262e2d37f

Neutron supports this vnic type, which ties in with the work that
enabled PF passthrough.

This patch makes sure to properly translate the 'direct-physical'
vnic-type port from Neutron to a request for a PF.

Change-Id: I51af36fc2edca3404a8f9efb32462f3680944be1
Partially-Implements: sriov-pf-passthrough-neutron-port
(cherry picked from commit 969a0c5a3037dd02a2d9682cd42ca400a97aefe3)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/74/306374/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova.network import model as network_modelPCI_DEVICE_TYPE_TAG = 'dev_type' DEVICE_TYPE_FOR_VNIC_TYPE = { network_model.VNIC_TYPE_DIRECT_PHYSICAL: obj_fields.PciDeviceType.SRIOV_PF }

commit_message:
Set db connection retry to infinity

Make sure that all the sevices will attempt to
connect to the database an infinite about of times.
If the database ever disappears for some reason we
want the services to try and reconnect more than just
10 times.

Closes-bug: #1505636
Change-Id: I77abbf72ce5bfd68faa451bb9a72bd2544963f4b
(cherry picked from commit 67333e4dd16f464c758735e1b6f58f87eac53b81)

commit_message:
Add  iscsid/tgtd specific parameters to Kolla infrastructure

This partially implements iscsi and lvm2 support for cinder
in Kolla. Add integration with Kolla infrastructure.

Change-Id: I5b7d59163518080f38aec0c00617440de0763f1d
Implements: blueprint iscsi-lvm2-docker

commit_message:
Adds ansible code for iscsid and tgtd containers

This partially implements iscsi and lvm2 support for cinder
in Kolla. Adds ansible code for iscsid and tgtd containers.

Change-Id: I2a4cfcf104397396ea61a09637d9ef3fc77b515f
Partially-Implements: blueprint iscsi-lvm2-docker

commit_message:
Install qemu-image from backports repo

qemu-image has been installed from testing to fix issues when
qemu-img can't convert image:
qemu-img: error writing zeroes at sector 0: Invalid argument

The issue has been fixed in qemu 2.2.0-rc2, reference [0].

Which has been added to debian backports.

This patch fixes issue with building coreos image, when qemu-utils
can't be installed from testing due to dependency problems.

Reference:
[0] http://git.qemu-project.org/?p=qemu.git;a=commitdiff;h=f3a9cfddae
[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1389728

Change-Id: Ie62a88e1d012aba1392b19c18137529c4c3ebf31
Related-Bug: #1490086
Closes-bug: #1570090
Closes-Bug: #1569835
(cherry picked from commit 52066d0a4920d2ccb3c6aef165e4a843ede4a809)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent refs/changes/23/306323/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Add 'backports' for qemu-utils RUN echo 'deb http://httpredir.debian.org/debian jessie-backports main' > /etc/apt/sources.list.d/backports.list proxy.sh apt-get --only-upgrade -t jessie-backports install -y qemu-utils
deleted_lines: # Add 'testing' for qemu-utils RUN echo 'APT::Default-Release "jessie";' > /etc/apt/apt.conf.d/10default && \ sed -e 's/jessie/testing/g' /etc/apt/sources.list > /etc/apt/sources.list.d/testing.list proxy.sh apt-get --only-upgrade -t testing install -y qemu-utils

commit_message:
Prohibit SRIOV enabled interfaces in bonds.

SRIOV enabled interfaces are not allowed in bonds according to
http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/fuel-specs/specs/9.0/support-sriov.html

Change-Id: Iadbb090ccfca92339638356bd1358a5213b2ee3b
Partial-Bug: 1558996

commit_message:
Fix sources preparation for the fuel-library package

Include upstream_modules.tar.gz to the source tar.gz
in case we are building the fuel-library package,
and USE_PREDEFINED_FUEL_LIB_PUPPET_MODULES is defined.

Closes-Bug: #1570331
Change-Id: I998d68e9a9cc900b3e0faf85d573fe36b8e39526
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-main refs/changes/62/306362/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ifneq ($(USE_PREDEFINED_FUEL_LIB_PUPPET_MODULES),) if [ "$1" = "fuel-library$(FUEL_LIBRARY_VERSION)" ]; then cd $(BUILD_DIR)/packages/sources/$1 && tar -rf $1.tar upstream_modules.tar.gz; fi endif

commit_message:
Make the ceph devstack-plugin-based job gating on Nova

This gets us back to gating on working ceph bits. The job has been
stable for quite some time now (over a month) and the only ceph-specific
failures have been actual regressions we have let into the tree because
this is not gating. We know this because we have a team of nova and
cinder people now monitoring status on a daily basis.

Change-Id: If97adae3fdbb823f0c7f6c01da96355afede4605

commit_message:
Fix grafana2 link of alarms

Current monasca devstack plugin installs grafana2 by default.
There are two grafana2 links in monasca menu.
One is in overview page and second is in alarms page.
But links in alarms page are still old and does not work.

Change-Id: I4247158d965c31660194e13f59a4fae67b405519

commit_message:
neutron: Update the port with a MAC address for PFs

In case of an SR-IOV PF as a neutron port, we should really update
Neutron with the proper MAC, as it is known only once the instance has
claimed a device on the compute host.

This patch adds a local Neutron API method that will grab the MAC
address based on the claimed device, and pass it on with the binding
port updates that happen during network allocation.

Change-Id: I7eafcaa9147bb9cbe7c7c8cda34ec259be0b0eb5
Implements: blueprint sriov-pf-passthrough-neutron-port
(cherry picked from commit ca9f12a9994ad9f10711301837beeb81cb851298)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/45/306345/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

mock_get_mac_by_pci_address.return_value = 'fake-mac-address' expected_port_req_body = {'port': {'mac_address': 'fake-mac-address'}} req = port_req_body.copy() api._populate_mac_address(instance, 0, req) self.assertEqual(expected_port_req_body, req) @mock.patch.object(pci_manager, 'get_instance_pci_devs') @mock.patch.object(pci_utils, 'get_mac_by_pci_address') def test_populate_mac_address_vf(self, mock_get_mac_by_pci_address, mock_get_instance_pci_devs): api = neutronapi.API() instance, pf, vf = self._populate_mac_address_fakes() port_req_body = {'port': {}} mock_get_instance_pci_devs.return_value = [vf] req = port_req_body.copy() api._populate_mac_address(instance, 42, port_req_body) self.assertEqual(port_req_body, req) @mock.patch.object(pci_manager, 'get_instance_pci_devs') @mock.patch.object(pci_utils, 'get_mac_by_pci_address') def test_populate_mac_address_vf_fail(self, mock_get_mac_by_pci_address, mock_get_instance_pci_devs): api = exception.PciDeviceNotFoundById) req = port_req_body.copy() api._populate_mac_address(instance, 42, port_req_body) self.assertEqual(port_req_body, req) @mock.patch.object(pci_manager, 'get_instance_pci_devs') def test_populate_mac_address_no_device(self, mock_get_instance_pci_devs): api = neutronapi.API() instance, pf, vf = self._populate_mac_address_fakes() port_req_body = {'port': {}} mock_get_instance_pci_devs.return_value = [] req = port_req_body.copy() api._populate_mac_address(instance, 42, port_req_body) self.assertEqual(port_req_body, req)

commit_message:
Refactor magic_search.js to support strict DI mode.

magic_search.js should be refactor to support strict DI mode, otherwise
it will block magic search box feature in horizon dashboard.

Change-Id: Iae982d6a597a6f8812f18d2b57f7384c9b39adc0
Closes-Bug: #1527059

commit_message:
Put py34 first in the env order of tox and remove py33

To solve the problem of "db type could
not be determined" on py34 we have to run first the py34 env to, then,
run py27. This patch puts py34 first on the tox.ini list of envs to
avoid this problem to happen.
Also, as per Infra, py33 support would be removed from Mitaka, so
taking care of the same as well in this patch.

Change-Id: Ib16b7070b263c19bb0439ece3efa9b33cbd1d2cc
Closes-bug: #1489059
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/xstatic-bootswatch refs/changes/38/260538/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: envlist = py33,py34,,py27downloadcache = ~/cache/pip

commit_message:
Put py34 first in the env order of tox

To solve the problem of "db type could not be determined" on py34 we
have to run first the py34 env to, then, run py27. This patch puts py34
first on the tox.ini list of envs to avoid this problem to happen.

Change-Id: Ief1349910375a0c5ee65823801db6b5f84619154
Closes-bug: #1489059
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/xstatic-angular-gettext refs/changes/33/260533/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: envlist = py33,py34,py27downloadcache = ~/cache/pip

commit_message:
Fix cluster scaling operations

This patch fixes cluster scaling operations so that cluster's
desired_capacity will change no matter physical nodes are
created/deleted successfully or not. The desired capacity should be
changed provided the logical nodes are operated successfully.

Closes-Bug: 1537663
Change-Id: I29387e856fde86f001d212a5063f861bb57caeec

commit_message:
update repo-build for ansible 2.1 compat

This change updates the repo-build process to be ansible2.1
compatible. The change is needed because the if statements in the
sting cause a \\ to exist if the variables are not used. To resolve
this issue the entry to the shell call has been changed to a folding
style instead of a literal style which will no longer generate the \\.

A change was also need in the op-venv script where we rely on a bash
script to build all of the venvs based on input provided by a folding
style string. Within Ansible 2.x the folding string type may have a \n
on the end which will break direct bash bash functions.

Change-Id: I394ab60f5505a45cf39b1efce1016dad9332be78
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

This commit uses the pattern established in [1] to remove the venv
activation code by using the correct venv Python interpreter instead.

Note that using python-path in keystone-httpd.conf.j2 does not achieve
full isolation from the host's python installation as we'd hope (the
path will still include /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages and
/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages), but every attempt at using
python-home failed due to the venv interpreter not being able to find

is the best solution long-term.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/273943/

commit_message:
Remove venv activation code

This commit uses the pattern established in [1] to remove the venv
activation code by using the correct venv Python interpreter instead.

Note that using python-path in keystone-httpd.conf.j2 does not achieve
full isolation from the host's python installation as we'd hope (the
path will still include /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages and
/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages), but every attempt at using
python-home failed due to the venv interpreter not being able to find
argparse.  We will need to spend some additional cycles here trying to
solve this as locking the venv interpreter into its own site-packages
is the best solution long-term.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/273943/

Change-Id: I441d8e488d9396583b4fafd454d14bc3fce20eb1

commit_message:
Fix sources preparation for the fuel-library package

Include upstream_modules.tar.gz to the source tar.gz
in case we are building the fuel-library package,
and USE_PREDEFINED_FUEL_LIB_PUPPET_MODULES is defined.

Closes-Bug: #1570331
Change-Id: I998d68e9a9cc900b3e0faf85d573fe36b8e39526
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-main refs/changes/17/306317/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ifneq ($(USE_PREDEFINED_FUEL_LIB_PUPPET_MODULES),) if [ "$1" = "fuel-library$(FUEL_LIBRARY_VERSION)" ]; then cd $(BUILD_DIR)/packages/sources/$1 && tar -rf $1.tar upstream_modules.tar.gz; fi endif

commit_message:
Add test for different amount of pinned CPU

This testgroup should be run with this parameters:

export KVM_USE=True
export SLAVE_NODE_CPU=6
export DRIVER_ENABLE_ACPI=true
export NUMA_NODES=2

Change-Id: Ida99b43992c854db33eab8c60ca52b0b73297f08
Implements: blueprint test-numa-cpu-pinning

commit_message:
Add exceptions hierarchy

nailgun.errors have a huge set of exceptions but without hierarchy. This
patch remove exception generation from dict and make it explicitly with
python classes and add some exceptions hierarchy. Now all network errors
inherit from NetworkException and same for other exceptions.

Change-Id: I9a2c6b358ea02a16711da74562308664ad7aed97
Closes-bug: #1566195

a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or # implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. import mock from sahara.cli import sahara_all from sahara.cli import sahara_api from sahara.cli import sahara_engine from sahara.tests.unit import base class TestSaharaCLI(base.SaharaTestCase): def setUp(self): super(TestSaharaCLI, self).setUp() modules = [ 'sahara.main.setup_common', 'oslo_service.wsgi.Server.__init__', 'oslo_service.wsgi.Loader' ] self.patchers = [] for module in modules: patch = mock.patch(module) patch.start() self.patchers.append(patch) mock_get_process_launcher_patch = \ mock.patch('sahara.main.get_process_launcher') self.patchers.append(mock_get_process_launcher_patch) self.mock_get_process_launcher = \ mock_get_process_launcher_patch.start() mock_start_server_patch = \ mock.patch('sahara.main.SaharaWSGIService.start') self.patchers.append(mock_start_server_patch) self.mock_start_server = mock_start_server_patch.start() def tearDown(self): super(TestSaharaCLI, self).tearDown() for patcher in reversed(self.patchers): patcher.stop() @mock.patch('sahara.main.setup_sahara_api') def test_main_start_api(self, mock_setup_sahara_api): sahara_api.main() self.mock_start_server.assert_called_once_with() self.mock_get_process_launcher.return_value.wait.\ assert_called_once_with() @mock.patch('sahara.utils.rpc.RPCServer.get_service') @mock.patch('oslo_service.service.ProcessLauncher') @mock.patch('sahara.service.ops.OpsServer') def test_main_start_engine(self, mock_ops_server, mock_process_launcher, mock_get_service): self.mock_get_process_launcher.return_value = mock_process_launcher mock_ops_server.return_value.get_service.return_value\ = mock_get_service sahara_engine.main() mock_process_launcher.launch_service.\ assert_called_once_with(mock_get_service) mock_process_launcher.wait.assert_called_once_with() def test_main_start_all(self): sahara_all.main() self.mock_start_server.assert_called_once_with() self.mock_get_process_launcher.return_value.wait.\ assert_called_once_with()

commit_message:
Use network space binding for shared-db relation

To ensure that the charm presents the right IP address for
accessing the MySQL database over the shared-db relation,
ensure that any network space binding provided by the user
is preferred over the default of 'private-address'.

If network spaces is not supported (juju < 2.0), fallback to
using 'private-address'.

Change-Id: Ic49f16c8ccceeb5aa25a2197a92767dc5aacf703
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-heat refs/changes/68/304668/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Access to the underlying MySQL instance can also be bound to a specific space using the shared-db relation. juju deploy heat --bind "public=public-space internal=internal-space admin=admin-space shared-db=internal-space" shared-db: internal-space

Change-Id: Ifa5d5ecd04507edb00e9befa1c7add075010258c

commit_message:
Isolate scenario args between iterations

We have several scenarios which modifies input data. Iterations of such
scenarios are not isolated between each other.

Also, this patch returns NeutronNetworks.create_and_update_ports scenario
from unstable to regular job.

Change-Id: Ifa5d5ecd04507edb00e9befa1c7add075010258c

commit_message:
Remove _show_resource from barbican resources

Now we can delete overrided _show_resource for
barbican resources in case of latest barbicanclient
version.

Change-Id: I9699cdc907ec7dd5bf975d19f6f4d4617f37d32d

commit_message:
Metrics tracking for TripleO deployment tasks

Track wall time metrics for:
 -tripleo.undercloud.install.seconds
 -tripleo.overcloud.images.seconds
 -tripleo.register.nodes.seconds
 -tripleo.introspect.seconds
 -tripleo.overcloud.{job_type}.deploy.seconds
 -tripleo.overcloud.{job_type}.settle.seconds
 -tripleo.overcloud.{job_type}.ping_test.seconds
 -tripleo.testenv.wait.seconds
 -tripleo.ci.total.seconds

Additionally we track the image size in MB for:
 -tripleo.overcloud.image.size_mb

Currently sending these to Dan's graphite server.

commit_message:
Make sure openstack services are dependent on openstack-core

Previously ceilometer-notification, aodh-listener and sahara-engine
didn't have constraints that would anchor them under openstack-core
dummy resource. Such constraints are added now. (sahara-engine starting
after sahara-api, aodh-listener after aodh-evaluator, and
ceilometer-notification after openstack-core.) Openstack-core ->
heat-api constraint has been removed because heat-api depends on
ceilometer-notification, so there's a transitive dependency on
openstack-core already.

Change-Id: Ided7321ebbf2c3556726343b4bb466fd8759b43a
Closes-Bug: #1569444

commit_message:
Fix API validation of DPDK properties on the node's interfaces

Now validator does not validate DPDK availability. It's always
calculated on the fly.
Also, validator now works properly when 'dpdk' section does not
present in API request.

Change-Id: Ibaf7919ac0068cdb6a1be93b74ebc0c4886ac934
Partial-Bug: #1564102
(cherry picked from commit 2a49a61a9d9ab3617872d223d516928255537d80)

commit_message:
Use values from endpoint map for service endpoints

Instead of using values hardcoded in os-cloud-config. This commit
uses the values that come from the endpoint map that's used
in the t-h-t. This in turns, allows us to be able to change the
port and even the host used for the public and internal endpoints;
this is still not the case for the admin endpoints, as it is based
on the internal endpoint of the service. The aforementioned
limitation comes from os-cloud-config.

Change-Id: I1abacf8b52357adec27d281e48375fb67253464d
(cherry picked from commit d67ccaf7baf7beb7ea3559c84ae0c645d0452dd8)

commit_message:
This patch include 3 other patches

1) Fixed building patch for saving deployment info

   Since 9.0 the deployment info is serialized only per node.

2) Adapt tests for new re-deployment logic

   Deployment logic was changed in [1] to start deployment
   tasks even if there are no changes to be deployed.

   This patch updates functional tests accordingly.

   1. I4a6f5f37161e4290050ec4926cf029cd7af566e4

3) Align git branches for tests

   We need to use stable/mitaka branch both in python-fuelclient
   and fuel-web

   Switching to full repo cloning since for now we need
   checkout to other branches

Change-Id: I2975a203a19c77ab2f31cb5413dc22e1417321ac

subject: Fix Neutron enable_*_agent* Hiera parameters
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-07 15:02:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/4057cf5b4bf52a89176d40605452c89000bbbf43', 'message': "Fix Neutron enable_*_agent* Hiera parameters

1) neutron::enable_*_agent parameters were not valid. The puppet-neutron
module does not know about these parameters. We should not use them in
our Hieradata. Let's rename them to enable_*_agent.

2) This change will fix a logic error when L3 agent was disabled, where
a Pacemaker constraint (neutron-dhcp-agent-to-l3-agent-constraint) were
still looking for l3_agent_service in the Puppet catalog, but could not
because L3 agent was disabled.
It was sending this Puppet error:
Error: Could not find dependency
Pacemaker::Resource::Service[neutron-l3-agent] for
Pacemaker::Constraint::Base[neutron-dhcp-agent-to-l3-agent-constraint]

Change-Id: I0e5d24d844810c58a3205303399d1c20773af3dd
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-07 20:31:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/12f3dd7bae1c964eb8c85e3cddf56ac4dc2f3510', 'message': "Fix Neutron enable_*_agent* Hiera parameters

commit_message:
Fix Neutron enable_*_agent* Hiera parameters

This change will fix a logic error when L3 agent was disabled, where
a Pacemaker constraint (neutron-dhcp-agent-to-l3-agent-constraint) were
still looking for l3_agent_service in the Puppet catalog, but could not
because L3 agent was disabled.
It was sending this Puppet error:
Error: Could not find dependency
Pacemaker::Resource::Service[neutron-l3-agent] for
Pacemaker::Constraint::Base[neutron-dhcp-agent-to-l3-agent-constraint]

Change-Id: I0e5d24d844810c58a3205303399d1c20773af3dd
